intro: Pisonia longifolia, commonly known as the silky pisonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it its common name. It thrives in coastal areas and is often found in mangrove ecosystems. Pisonia longifolia is known for its fragrant flowers and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
